question_text: Why is AC power typically used for power transmission over long distances?
answer_options: It has lower resistance than DC
It can be easily converted to different voltages using transformers
It produces less heat in appliances
It flows more uniformly through wires
correct_answer: It can be easily converted to different voltages using transformers
explanation: AC can be transformed to higher or lower voltages efficiently, which makes it ideal for transmission over long distances.
